Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli

Class CLI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli.CLI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI, PropertyChangeListener, EventListener
public class CLI extends Object implements UI
CLI is the main class for everything regarding the CLI client. It parses the user input and prints all that's needed to play the game.

    Constructor CLI creates a new CLI instance.

      public CLI()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The CLI main method. It creates the CLI instance and lets the user select the Server's IP and port.
      Parameters:
      args - the program arguments.

    • run

      public void run()
      Method run listens for the CLI input until the game closes.

    • setup

      public void setup()
      method setup asks the username and establishes the connection with the server.

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Listener pattern implementation. This prints all the necessary information from the server at the moment of reception.
      Specified by:
      propertyChange in interface PropertyChangeListener
      Parameters:
      evt - the information to be printed

    • statePrinter

      public void statePrinter(GameState oldState, GameState newState)
      Method statePrinter prints the current game state and the current round owner.
      Parameters:
      oldState - the old state of the game.
      newState - the new state of the game.

    • roundPrinter

      public void roundPrinter(String oldRoundOwner, String newRoundOwner)
      Method roundPrinter prints on the screen the round owner updates.
      Parameters:
      oldRoundOwner - the previous round owner.
      newRoundOwner - the current round owner.

    • isActiveGame

      public boolean isActiveGame()
      Method isActiveGame returns if the game is active.
      Returns:
      true if the game is active, false otherwise

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Method clearScreen clears the user's terminal.
